subject: Art & Design
title: Diegetic vs. Non-Diegetic Sound
description: A quick win: understand Diegetic vs. Non-Diegetic Sound.

hook.text: A character turns on a radio and music plays. That's diegetic. The dramatic score underneath is not.

buildup.text: Diegetic sound exists within the story world: dialogue, car horns, a phone ringing. Characters can hear it.

discovery.text: Non-diegetic sound is added for the audience only: narration, score, sound effects. Characters are unaware.

twist.text: Edgar Wright blurs the line: in Baby Driver, car chases are choreographed to the character's earbuds playlist.

climax.text: Breaking diegesis â€” when a score suddenly becomes a source sound or vice versa â€” creates surprise.

punchline.text: Half the sounds in any film don't exist inside the story.

quiz.question: What is diegetic sound in film?
options: Sound that exists within the story world and characters can hear
Background music added for the audience only
